snippet: The Stone Avenue branch of the Brooklyn Public Library is celebrating its anniversary and reflecting on its mission as a haven for children within a tough neighborhood.
abstract: Stone Avenue branch of the Brooklyn Public Library in Brownsville, NY, is celebrating its 100-year anniversary and reflecting on its mission as a haven for children within a tough neighborhood; Brownsville is home to over 86,000 residents and has one of the largest concentrations of public housing in the nation; more than half of area's children live below federal poverty line and only a third meet city and state reading standards.
lead_paragraph: The Stone Avenue branch of the Brooklyn Public Library is celebrating its anniversary and reflecting on its mission as a haven for children within a tough neighborhood.

headline.seo: A Century Later, Children Still Finding Sanctuary at Brownsville Library
headline.main: A Brownsville Sanctuary, 100 Years and Counting
headline.print_headline: A Brownsville Sanctuary, 100 Years and Counting
